alert.note: Alert for Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 10:29AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...far northeastern Luce County in Upper Michigan. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding and rises in small streams. Water flowing over and ponding on roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1024 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated continued moderate rain showers and decreasing coverage of the heaviest rain due to thunderstorms. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the next 2 hours in the advisory area and will result in additional minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Betsy Lake and Crisp Point. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
